text: Using tools and equipment to build or fix something physical sounds like a great day to me.
scale: Absolutely not. I'd rather watch paint dry.
Not really my vibe, but maybe once.
Could be okay in small doses.
Yeah, I'd probably enjoy that kind of work.
Totally. Let me fix, build, tinker — I'm in.

text: I love solving problems that don’t have obvious answers — especially if it means digging deep into research or data.
scale: That sounds like a brain fog nightmare.
Only if someone else is guiding me.
Maybe — if I'm in the right headspace.
Honestly, that kind of thing gets me thinking.
Yes. Give me the puzzle. I'm fully invested.

text: Being able to express myself creatively at work is a non-negotiable.
scale: Hard pass. I don't need that at all.
I can live without it, sure.
It'd be a nice bonus if it's there.
I'd feel a little lost without that outlet.
If I'm not creating, something's missing in me.

text: Helping someone understand something complicated makes me feel genuinely good.
scale: Nope. Sounds like a patience test.
Maybe, but only if I have to.
Sometimes it’s kinda rewarding, I guess.
Yeah, I get a buzz from that.
Absolutely. Helping someone 'get it' is magic.

text: Convincing someone to see things my way is actually kind of thrilling.
scale: Noooope. I run from confrontation.
Only if it's really important.
Sometimes, if I'm in the zone.
I love a good debate or pitch.
Let me talk. I was born for this.

text: Organizing chaos into a clean, labeled system brings me a weird amount of joy.
scale: Mess is fine. I thrive in the void.
Structure is... meh. I’ll survive.
Okay, I admit — order has its perks.
It’s satisfying to bring logic to the madness.
Yes. I want folders in my folders. Bring it on.
